item.title: Unregistration from Redhat Satellite or Spacewalk Server
item.description: Ideally use 1 # subscription-manager unregister¬† Otherwise: 1 # rm /etc/sysconfig/rhn/systemid¬† should do the trick.

item.title: CGRateS Tutorial Series- Installation ‚Äì Mongo DB Server Install ‚Äì Debian 8 ‚Äì Part 1
item.description: Below are the steps to prepare a stand alone mongodb server for cgrates on Debian 8 jessie Install sudo 1 # apt-get install sudo Import key 1 # apt-key adv --keyserver hkp://keyserver.ubuntu.com:80 --recv 0C49F3730359A14518585931BC711F9BA15703C6 Add repository URL 1 # echo "deb http://repo.mongodb.org/apt/debian jessie/mongodb-org/3.4 main" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/mongodb-org-3.4.list Update and Install 1 2 3 # apt-get update # apt-get install -y mongodb-org Enable and Start

item.title: Gain Settings for DJI Naza M v2
item.description: I have been¬†building myself a quad copter , specifically a DJI F450 Flamewheel with DJI E305 propulsion system hooked to a DJI Naza M V2 with GPS. I have found the gain settings to be really tricky to play with , so this is a reference for anyone who wants to learn more about gains. Here‚Äôs a video of a guy from Netherlands explaining the gains in detail: ¬†Below are the standard gain settings for Naza M v2 from DJI

item.title: Remove /home partition on CentOS 6
item.description: Centos by default creates a separate LVM with /home , which is un-necessary in certain installs , to remove it, follow the procedure To check the current status: Executing the changes: Checking size again: Modifying /etc/fstab to remove the mount point for /home

item.title: CentOS 7 Wifi :: Intel 6205
item.description: Out of the box , everything should work except Wifi. nmtui should be used for setting up the connection. Cheers!

item.title: Configure Your PTCL SmartLink SIP Account On Freeswitch
item.description: Following up on my previous post on how to configure your PTCL Smart Link SIP account on asterisk, below is the configuration I used for PTCL ‚Äì Just replace USERNAME and PASSWORD with your credentials. You will also need to change your user agent , This can be done by adding the below parameter in sip_profiles/external.xml

item.title: Howto :: LAMP Stack on Centos 7
item.description: Quick and Dirty install below! Install HTTPD Start and Enable Boot-Startup of httpd Install & Start / Boot-Start MariaDB ( A drop-in mysql replacement ) Secure Your MySQL Installation Add PHP & Mysql Support ‚Äì Restart HTTPD Optional Package Install ‚Äì You can add PHP Extensions by using the ‚Äòyum search‚Äô command to find and ‚Äòyum install‚Äô to install. Finally , Open up ports on FirewallD Optional ‚Äì mcrypt and imagemagick support

item.title: Service Management Cheat Sheet :: CentOS 6 & 7
item.description: Below is a conversion document for Centos 6 to 7 Service Management! <th> systemctl </th> <th> Description </th> <td> <div class="para"> <code class="command">systemctl start &lt;em class="replaceable">name&lt;/em>.service</code> </div> </td> <td> Starts a service. </td> <td> <div class="para"> <code class="command">systemctl stop &lt;em class="replaceable">name&lt;/em>.service</code> </div> </td> <td> Stops a service. </td> <td> <div class="para"> <code class="command">systemctl restart &lt;em class="replaceable">name&lt;/em>.service</code> </div> </td> <td> Restarts a service. </td> <td> <div class="para"> <code class="command">systemctl try-restart &lt;em class="replaceable">name&lt;/em>.

item.title: Asterisk Config for PTCL SmartLink App
item.description: PTCL has recently launched an app called ‚ÄúSmartLink‚Äù , Which provides you access to your phone line over SIP , essentially providing landline access from anywhere. Since the land-line I have is only used for DSL and SmartTV, I wanted to set it up on SIP , so I can access it from any device. PTCL uses Huawei SoftX 3000 Soft Switches for this service , I have had experience on these switches from my previous jobs and I know that it requires PRACK support to start off , In addition , while configuring , I noticed that the user_agent also needs to be set to a certain value for the registration to be successful.

item.title: Open VPN Installation on Centos 6.5
item.description: In a rush , so will jot down the steps only. You‚Äôll need epel repo On CentOS 6 , that will be Once that is done , yum install openvpn easy-rsa mkdir -p /etc/openvpn/easy-rsa/keys cp -rf /usr/share/easy-rsa/2.0/* /etc/openvpn/easy-rsa/ vi /etc/openvpn/easy-rsa/vars Modify these parameters to suit your need cd /etc/openvpn/easy-rsa/ cp openssl-1.0.0.cnf openssl.cnf source ./vars ./clean-all ./build-ca ./build-key-server server ./build-key client ( if you want to use RSA Keys for Connectivity )

item.title: OpenVPN Configuration
item.description: Below is the configuration i use for OpenVPN server , It supports user / password authentication,TCP mode and disables TLS which is not supported by Mikrotik ( atleast for now )

item.title: Mikrotik OpenVPN Client Config
item.description: Following up on my previous post , Below is the configuration for setting up an OPENVPN Client on Mikrotik Router After this goto IP > Firewall > NAT and add a SRC nat rule to masqurade all traffic going towards the VPN oh and make sure you have a static route added for your VPN server IP address towards your primary gateway. and that should be it!

item.title: Routing Traffic to VPN on Mikrotik
item.description: I am addicted to spotify and netflix and since I am based out of middle east and use a lot of devices ( hand helds , laptops , media streaming boxes etc. ) , the only solution was to implement routing to my VPN service on the gateway which in my case is a mikrotik RB2011UAS-iNHD. I also didn‚Äôt want to route all of my traffic to the VPN since it slows down the internet considerably due to latency / headers etc .

item.title: Ajenti Control Panel
item.description: Ajenti 1 Webserver control panel is an amazing server administration panel written in Python. ¬†1¬†http://ajenti.org/[

item.title: ServiceXpress Framework :: ChrisXpress Browserless Solution
item.description: Hi, Had a nightmare of a task yesterday to configure SX for faster access over VPN. The only solution was to do it browser less , anyone who knows and / or has used ChrissXpress will agree , that its extremely slow and tightly bound around Java 1.3.1 . The solution was to download all of the jar files from the framework and copy them over to JAVA_HOME/lib and create a small script to launch it by clicking.

item.title: Cisco ASA VPN Woes!
item.description: This is to document the config for outside access to VPN , incase i forget again! access-list outside_nat extended permit ip [vpn client network] 255.255.255.0 any global (outside) 1 interface nat (outside) 1 access-list outside_nat group-policy DfltGrpPolicy attributes dns-server value [dns server] nem enable group-policy VPN attributes split-tunnel-policy tunnelall split-tunnel-network-list none

item.title: Opendiameter Compilation Instructions
item.description: For FC8 Make sure gcc , gcc-c++ , bison , flex , make , openssl and openssl-devel are present yum -y install boost-devel export BOOST_ROOT=/usr/include/ Get ACE Here . tar xvf ACE-5.5.tar.gz cd ACE_wrappers mkdir build cd build Patch the configure file ‚Äî configure.orig 2008-08-05 11:11:19.000000000 -0800 +++ configure 2008-08-05 11:13:30.

item.title: Freeswitch :: Wateen Update
item.description: Just a quick update , anthm @ freeswitch.org has fixed the bug in freeswitch that was preventing the switch to register with Wateen‚Äôs gateway. So , go , grab the latest freeswitch code from svn and compile. Here are the settings for your sip_profile _üôÇ Have fun! and drop a comment if this post was helpful.

item.title: Mobilink Infinity :: Freeswitch :: One Way Audio
item.description: If you are facing one way audio issue with freeswitch for all outgoing calls via mobilink infinity trunk , all you need to do is to edit conf/vars.xml and set EXT_SIP_IP & EXT_RTP_IP to 192.168.100.1 . That‚Äôs it , your one way audio issue will be resolved üôÇ .

item.title: Howto configure Mobilink Infinity VoIP on Freeswitch
item.description:
You can configure your mobilink infinity VoIP number on Freeswitch aswell , Freeswitch is a very nice alternative to Asterisk with a SIP stack that actually works! BKW @ #freeswitch on irc.freenode.net helped me with this üôÇ Here is the conf/sip_profiles/external/mobilink.xml settings _Here‚Äôs the dialplan entry conf/dialplan/extensions/000_myext.xml
Oh by the way , for this, make sure the SIP ALG on your outdoor cpe is turned on , while the indoor one needs to be off üôÇ

item.title: Howto Use Wateen on Your Softphone
item.description: Here‚Äôs the info on howto use your wateen number on your softphone from anywhere in the world! User name: 051800XXXX Authorization User: 051800XXXX@wateen.com** Domain:** wateen.com **Proxy:** 58.27.240.22:9060 You can get the Wateen user name from support@wateen.com

item.title: Howto register your Mobilink Infinity VoIP number on Softphone
item.description: Here are the SIP settings , if you want to use your VoIP number from Mobilink Infinity on a softphone. You‚Äôll have to first logon to your CPE admin interface , Browse to NAT -> ALG and Uncheck ‚ÄúSIP ALG‚Äù and click Apply. If you use an outdoor unit , do the same with the outdoor CPE as well. Fireup x-lite and configure it with the following settings. Server: 10.215.11.250
